subject: Medicine
title: Drug Tolerance
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Drug Tolerance.

hook.text: Your first cup of coffee wakes you up. After months of daily coffee, you need three cups for the same effect.

buildup.text: Tolerance develops when the body adapts to a drug, requiring higher doses to achieve the same response.

discovery.text: The body can downregulate receptors, speed up metabolism, or dampen downstream signaling pathways.

twist.text: Opioid tolerance is especially dangerousâ€”the lethal dose stays the same even as the effective dose climbs.

climax.text: Understanding tolerance is critical for managing chronic pain, addiction, and long-term medication use.

punchline.text: The body adapts to everythingâ€”including the drugs you take.

quiz.question: Why is opioid tolerance particularly dangerous?
options: The lethal dose stays constant while the effective dose keeps rising
Opioid tolerance never actually develops in patients
Tolerant patients are immune to opioid overdose
